title: More than a digital system: how AI is changing the role of bureaucrats in different organizational contexts
research_description: The study examines the evolving role of bureaucrats in public organizations influenced by AI-driven technologies. It provides an in-depth analysis of how AI affects decision-making processes, service delivery, and the organizational structure of public institutions. Using a comparative case study across public service organizations in the Netherlands and the US, it highlights both incremental and transformative changes brought by AI in public management.
research_results: The introduction of AI technologies in the public sector is driving significant changes in both decision-making efficiency and the organizational roles of bureaucrats. The findings reveal that while AI improves service delivery, it also necessitates new governance frameworks to address issues of accountability and oversight.
future_research: Future research should explore the broader implications of AI adoption on bureaucratic accountability, transparency, and the long-term effects on public sector governance across different cultural and institutional contexts.
